other_tests.findings: Episodes of sinus bradycardia with peripheral apnea/hypopnea, suggesting vagal hypertonia.
Episodes of sinus bradycardia with peripheral apnea/hypopnea, suggesting vagal hypertonia.

Extremely pathological; showing slow, symmetrical, alternating delta and theta activity with numerous episodes of multifocal, asynchronous, abundant, and diffuse spikes and spikes-waves predominantly in the central and occipital regions.
other_tests.changes_over_time: An almost total absence of stimuli response indicative of severe epileptic encephalopathy.

other_tests.date: Normal at birth and repeated at 5 months

other_tests.findings: Revealed two likely pathogenic variants in TSPYL1 in compound heterozygous state.
Confirmed the presence of two pathogenic variants in TSPYL1.
Did not return any additional candidate variants that could explain the epileptic phenotype.
